Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or supporting information to validate the statement that UP students will not receive scholarships this year.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the ABP News graphic is accurate and represents a genuine report by the channel, without providing any proof.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the UP government has set aside a budget for scholarships and is awaiting approval from the finance commission.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim may have an alternative explanation, such as the graphic being morphed or manipulated to misrepresent the government's stance on scholarships.
Falters at times: The claim falters in providing consistent and reliable information, as the font and format of the viral graphic do not match genuine ABP News graphics.
Understate: The claim may potentially understate the actual situation regarding scholarships for UP students, as there are reports of scholarship applications being issued by the education ministry.
Exaggerate: There is no evidence of exaggeration in the claim.
